title: AI Fluency vs. AI Awareness: What Leaders Must Know
author: Scaled Agile
description: Explains the growing fluency gap between basic AI awareness and strategic capability, and why organizations that fail to bridge it face financial waste and talent attrition.

title: The AI Fluency Framework, Explained
author: Scrum.org
description: Video explanation of the 4D competency framework (Delegation, Description, Discernment, Diligence) and the three modes of AI engagement: automation, augmentation, and agency.

title: AI Fluency Leveling
author: Alex Ewerlöf
description: The original seven-level framework of AI fluency, progressing from casual consumption of tools to pioneering fundamental research.

title: AI Fluency Leveling — Original Note
author: Alex Ewerlöf
description: The original social post introducing the seven-level AI fluency framework for assessing knowledge workers in the age of AI.

title: Advanced Prompt Engineering Techniques: Examples & Best Practices
author: Patronus AI
description: Comprehensive guide to advanced prompt engineering covering temperature control, system messages, delimiters, role simulation, and iterative refinement strategies.

title: Evaluating Transformer Architectures: Metrics & Benchmarks
author: Future AGI
description: Deep dive into evaluation metrics for transformer models including perplexity, ROUGE scores, F1-Score, and adversarial robustness benchmarks.

title: Basics of AI Models
author: Langdock
description: Foundational explanation of how AI models work, covering inference versus training, probabilistic prediction, and the concept of AI as an inference engine rather than a magic box.

title: What is a Context Window?
author: IBM
description: Foundational article on context windows as AI's working memory, covering tokens, tokenization efficiency across languages, and practical implications for API costs.

title: Understanding LLM Context Windows: Tokens, Attention, and Challenges
author: Tahir Balarabe
description: Explains how exceeding the context window leads to information loss and hallucinations, and how attention mechanisms distribute focus across tokens.

title: Understanding Tokens & Context Windows
author: MLQ.ai
description: Practical guide to token approximation rules (1 token ~ 4 characters, 100 tokens ~ 75 words) and their implications for model usage.

title: A Guide to Tokens and Context in LLMs (for Beginners)
author: DEV Community
description: Beginner-friendly explanation of how chat interfaces resend entire conversation history, and why starting new chats or summarizing improves performance.

title: AI Fluency Leveling — Leadership in Tech
author: Leadership in Tech
description: Newsletter coverage of the AI fluency leveling framework with focus on practical application for technology leaders.

title: Fine-Tuning for Transformer Models
author: Meegle
description: Covers fine-tuning pre-trained models for specialized tasks in healthcare, law, and biomedical domains, including domain adaptation strategies and performance metrics.

title: The Best AI Books & Courses for Getting a Job
author: Towards Data Science
description: Curated list of essential AI books and courses including recommendations for Hands-On ML by Géron, AI Engineering by Chip Huyen, and Andrej Karpathy's tutorials.

title: 14 Educational AI YouTubers Teaching ML in 2025
author: DigitalOcean
description: Guide to the best AI and ML YouTube channels including DeepLearning.AI, Two Minute Papers, and Tina Huang for different skill levels.

title: Advanced Prompt Engineering Techniques in 2025
author: Maxim AI
description: Coverage of zero-shot prompting, few-shot in-context learning, chain-of-thought reasoning, and other advanced techniques as emergent properties of model scale.

title: Advanced Prompt Engineering Techniques for 2025: Beyond Basic Instructions
author: Reddit r/PromptEngineering
description: Community discussion of controlled hallucination for speculative innovation and recursive self-improvement for iterative output refinement, reporting ~60% reduction in revision cycles.

title: Build a Complete RAG Application with Laravel and Neuron AI
author: Neuron AI
description: Comprehensive video tutorial for building a production-ready RAG system where users can chat with their own data, covering ingestion, chunking, and retrieval.

description: Short course covering hybrid search, facial similarity, and recommender systems using vector databases for RAG pipelines.

description: Visual explanation of vector databases, embeddings, high-dimensional semantic similarity search, and HNSW indexing for millisecond retrieval.

title: Chroma: Vector DB for AI Development — A Complete Guide
author: Towards Dev

description: Tutorial for building RAG applications using Cloudflare Workers AI, Vectorize, and the Wrangler CLI for edge-deployed AI systems.

author: Alex Ewerlöf

title: Code Series — Alex Ewerlöf Notes
author: Alex Ewerlöf
